data.title: Mangrove: Infer galaxy properties using dark matter merger trees
data.name: Mangrove
data.description: Using Graph Neural Networks to regress baryonic properties directly from full dark matter merger trees.

evidence: "Short story: Using Dark Matter Merger Trees to infer galaxy properties works much better than everything else out there! Check out our Google Colab Tutorial on how to use the model" (end users run the model and tutorial as an application).

"For people looking to reproduce the results of our paper (https://arxiv.org/abs/2210.13473), ğ™¼ğšŠğš—ğšğš›ğš˜ğšŸğš: Learning Galaxy Properties from Merger Trees, the folders to look are in data and dev." (software directly used to reproduce paperâ€™s scientific results).

README describes cloning/using code and setting up a conda environment, but does not mention PyPI, conda-forge, Docker, or other registries; distribution appears to be via the repository source and scripts.
